tech.cae.jsdf.v1_5

Class Sensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • tech.cae.jsdf.v1_5.Sensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SDFType

    @JsonClassDescription(value="The sensor tag describes the type and properties of a sensor.")
public final class Sensor
extends Object
implements SDFType
    The sensor tag describes the type and properties of a sensor.

      • toString

        public final String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(Object other)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • getName

        public final String getName()
        A unique name for the sensor. This name must not match another model in the model.

      • getType

        public final String getType()
        The type name of the sensor. By default, SDFormat supports types\n altimeter,\n camera,\n contact,\n depth,\n force_torque,\n gps,\n gpu_ray,\n imu,\n logical_camera,\n magnetometer,\n multicamera,\n ray,\n rfid,\n rfidtag,\n sonar,\n wireless_receiver, and\n wireless_transmitter.

      • getAlwaysOn

        public final Boolean getAlwaysOn()
        If true the sensor will always be updated according to the update rate.

      • getUpdateRate

        public final Double getUpdateRate()
        The frequency at which the sensor data is generated. If left unspecified, the sensor will generate data every cycle.

      • getVisualize

        public final Boolean getVisualize()
        If true, the sensor is visualized in the GUI

      • getTopic

        public final String getTopic()
        Name of the topic on which data is published. This is necessary for visualization

      • getFrame

        public final List<Frame> getFrame()
        A frame of reference to which a pose is relative.

      • getPose

        public final Pose getPose()
        A position(x,y,z) and orientation(roll, pitch yaw) with respect to the specified frame.

      • getPlugin

        public final List<Plugin> getPlugin()
        A plugin is a dynamically loaded chunk of code. It can exist as a child of world, model, and sensor.

      • getAltimeter

        public final Altimeter getAltimeter()
        These elements are specific to an altimeter sensor.

      • getCamera

        public final SensorCamera getCamera()
        These elements are specific to camera sensors.

      • getImu

        public final Imu getImu()
        These elements are specific to the IMU sensor.

      • getLogicalCamera

        public final LogicalCamera getLogicalCamera()
        These elements are specific to logical camera sensors. A logical camera reports objects that fall within a frustum. Computation should be performed on the CPU.

      • getMagnetometer

        public final Magnetometer getMagnetometer()
        These elements are specific to a Magnetometer sensor.

        These elements are specific to the ray (laser) sensor.

        These elements are specific to a wireless transceiver.

      • setName

        public final void setName(String name)
        A unique name for the sensor. This name must not match another model in the model.

      • setType

        public final void setType(String type)
        The type name of the sensor. By default, SDFormat supports types\n altimeter,\n camera,\n contact,\n depth,\n force_torque,\n gps,\n gpu_ray,\n imu,\n logical_camera,\n magnetometer,\n multicamera,\n ray,\n rfid,\n rfidtag,\n sonar,\n wireless_receiver, and\n wireless_transmitter.

      • setAlwaysOn

        public final void setAlwaysOn(Boolean alwaysOn)
        If true the sensor will always be updated according to the update rate.

      • setUpdateRate

        public final void setUpdateRate(Double updateRate)
        The frequency at which the sensor data is generated. If left unspecified, the sensor will generate data every cycle.

      • setVisualize

        public final void setVisualize(Boolean visualize)
        If true, the sensor is visualized in the GUI
